item.title: Euro 2021 Final: Small number of fans broke into Wembley, say police
item.description: Videos show dozens of ticketless fans pushing through barriers and gates ahead of the match.

item.title: Euro 2020: All eyes on Wembley as fans watch England in final
item.description: Around 60,000 supporters are at the stadium, while millions more are watching in pubs and at home.

item.title: US heatwave: Wildfires rage in western states as temperatures soar
item.description: Tributes are paid to two firefighters who died in a plane crash while responding to a blaze in Arizona.

item.title: Wimbledon 2021: Novak Djokovic beats Matteo Berrettini for 20th Grand Slam title
item.description: Novak Djokovic wins his sixth Wimbledon title and record-equalling 20th men's Grand Slam by fighting back to beat Italy's Matteo Berrettini.

item.title: Virgin Galactic: Sir Richard Branson rockets to the edge of space
item.description: The UK businessman realises a lifetime's ambition by riding a rocket plane high into the sky.

item.title: Georgia: Cameraman dies after attack at anti-Pride march
item.description: Lekso Lashkarava, who was badly injured, was found dead in the Georgian capital Tbilisi on Sunday.

item.title: Covid-19: Masks still expected to be worn indoors after 19 July - Zahawi
item.description: England is moving from "you must" wear a mask to "you are expected to", the vaccines minister says.

item.title: Ex-England star finishes Tour de France for charity
item.description: A team of amateur cyclists complete the race route and raise £1m for a blood cancer charity.

item.title: Dr Martens and Rushden and Diamonds founder Max Griggs dies
item.description: Peterborough United's Barry Fry describes Max Griggs as "a great football man".

item.title: CBI employers group calls for early end to self-isolation rules
item.description: The CBI says it would ease staff shortages and help make the economic reopening "confident" rather than "anxious".

item.title: Zuma jailed: Arrests as protests spread in South Africa
item.description: Police say criminals are taking advantage of the unrest following the former president's jailing.

item.title: Cocaine 'worth £2m' found floating off Sussex beach
item.description: Several packages have been found in the water off Seaford since Thursday, police say.

item.title: Hot air balloon crashes in Nottinghamshire town centre
item.description: Pilot Andrew Davidson said he has never had such a landing in more than 30 years of ballooning.

item.title: Euro 2020 final: England off to dream start as Luke Shaw scores early opener against Italy at Wembley
item.description: England make a dream start to their first major men's football final in 55 years as Luke Shaw's early goal gives them a 1-0 lead over Italy in the Euro 2020 final at Wembley.

item.title: Match of the Day pundits celebrate Shaw's goal
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer, Frank Lampard and Rio Ferdinand celebrate Luke Shaw's goal to take the early 1-0 lead against Italy during the final of Euro 2020 at Wembley.

item.title: England's route to Euro 2020 final
item.description: Watch every goal scored by England at Euro 2020 so far, including efforts from Raheem Sterling and Harry Kane.

item.title: Euro 2020 final: Baddiel and Skinner reunite to sing Three Lions
item.description: David Baddiel, Frank Skinner and the Lighting Seeds perform in London ahead of the Euro 2020 final.

item.title: Italy v England in Euro 2020 final - rate the players
item.description: Rate the players in the Euro 2020 final between Italy and England.

item.title: Euro 2020 final: Which side of England's 'Little Italy' will get to celebrate?
item.description: Around one in five people in the town of Bedford is Italian, meaning divided loyalties for the Euros final.

item.title: Meet the Italians standing between England and glory
item.description: Everything you need to know about the Italians who stand in the way of England and the European Championship trophy

item.title: Euro 2020: Kalvin Phillips' rise from Wortley to Wembley
item.description: The 25-year-old's Euro 2020 heroics have been cheered on by friends and family back in Leeds.

item.title: Football-mad Italians gear up for big night
item.description: Italy's success in the Euro competition has lifted spirits after the pandemic, Mark Lowen reports.

item.title: In pictures: England's excitement ahead of final
item.description: The nation shares high hopes and nerves as England play Italy in the Euro 2020 final.

item.title: Euro 2020 final: How to watch and follow Italy v England on the BBC
item.description: England are one win away from a first major men's tournament triumph since 1966 - and you can watch and follow all the action from Sunday's Euro 2020 final with Italy on the BBC.

item.title: 'Euro 96 was tears of sadness, Euro 2020 tears of pure joy'
item.description: From the 1966 World Cup triumph to the last 55 years of hurt, these are your memories of following the Three Lions.

item.title: Euro 2020: Jewels remain... Get Grealish... England fan-speak explained
item.description: Why is football coming home? Who was Jules Rimet? And what's a penalty shootout? Read on...

item.title: Miami building collapse: Inside the recovery operation clearing the ruins
item.description: Miami-Dade Fire Rescue show how workers are clearing the "enormous" pile of ruins that remains.

item.title: Pandemic heroes' portraits to be pasted up in Bridgwater
item.description: A woman who helped depressed farmers is among those being honoured in a giant mural.

item.title: Thousands of fish dropped from plane to restock Utah lakes
item.description: Wildlife authorities in Utah do this to restock lakes that aren't accessible to other forms of transport.

item.title: ICYMI: A big cat 3D billboard and a tiny celebrity cow
item.description: Watch our round-up of the week's more paw-sitive stories that you miaow have missed.

item.title: Euro 2020: The pride of England stars' hometowns
item.description: We meet those in the England stars' hometowns who hope the boys can bring football home - literally.

item.title: Euro 2020: Ex-SAS Atlantic rower relying on text updates for final
item.description: Ex-SAS soldier Ian Rivers has no way of seeing or hearing Sunday's England v Italy match.

item.title: Euro 2020: Gareth Southgate's neighbours praise 'lovely, humble man'
item.description: 'Humble' Gareth Southgate is well-loved by people who live and work near his North Yorkshire home.

item.title: Virgin Galactic: Richard Branson's long, winding path to space
item.description: The BBC tracks the long, winding road to Sir Richard Branson's flight to the edge of space.

item.title: 'Indians don't talk about sex - so I help them'
item.description: An Indian sex coach says parents turn to her for advice as sex education is not available in schools.

item.title: The foreigners in China’s disinformation drive
item.description: Foreigners are increasingly appearing on YouTube promoting China's narrative on issues like Xinjiang.

item.title: How did my phone number end up for sale on a US database?
item.description: A journey of discovery into the somewhat opaque, if lucrative, world of contact selling

item.title: From living in a tent to financial independence
item.description: Schemes helping homeless people lacking IDs to get bank accounts are transforming hundreds of lives.

item.title: William Orr: The blind postman who delivered a first-class service
item.description: A County Antrim postman is being studied by English academics as part of a UK-wide history project.

item.title: Why Canada is reforming indigenous foster care
item.description: The residential school legacy has been linked to the overrepresentation of indigenous children in care.

item.title: Are lots of people deleting the NHS Covid app?
item.description: Are people using the government's Covid app or are they deleting it?

item.title: Euro 2020: England players' friends and family leave heartfelt voice messages before final
item.description: The friends, family, mentors and coaches of the England players who will take on Italy in the Euro 2020 final leave voice messages to wish them well.

item.title: 'This girl is so good' - Verma stars & England collapse in thrilling second T20
item.description: Shafali Verma makes 48 as India produce an excellent performance in an eight-run win which sets up a decider in the multi-format series against England.

item.title: McGregor breaks leg in first-round defeat by Poirier at UFC 264
item.description: Dustin Poirier beats Conor McGregor in the first round of their trilogy fight at UFC 264 in Las Vegas.

item.title: Wimbledon 2021: Neal Skupski and Desirae Krawczyk win mixed doubles title
item.description: Britain's Neal Skupski and American partner Desirae Krawczyk beat Britons Harriet Dart and Joe Salisbury to win the Wimbledon mixed doubles final.

item.title: Sprinter Asher-Smith out of British Grand Prix
item.description: British sprinter Dina Asher-Smith withdraws from Tuesday's British Grand Prix event in Gateshead as a precaution with a tight hamstring.

item.title: Kuss claims Tour de France stage 15 win as Pogacar increases overall lead
item.description: Sepp Kuss attacks on the final climb to win stage 15 of the Tour de France, as Tadej Pogacar increases his overall lead.

item.title: Giro d'Italia Donne 2021: Anna van der Breggen wins event for fourth time
item.description: Anna van der Breggen clinches her fourth Giro d'Italia Donne title after finishing fourth in the 10th and final stage.

item.title: Euro 2020 and Covid: How can I watch the final?
item.description: Wembley will host 60,000 fans at the final, but millions will be watching on TV at home and in pubs.

item.title: I'm 17 - when will I be jabbed? And other questions
item.description: We answer some of your questions about England's roadmap out of lockdown, and other Covid-related issues.

item.title: Vaccine passports: How can I prove I've had both my Covid jabs?
item.description: Fully-vaccinated people in England will be able to avoid self-isolation after travel or contact with a positive case.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.
